intro: Eriogonum fruticosum, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or upright growth habit, often forming dense mats. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Eriogonum fruticosum is often found in coastal dunes, grasslands, and rocky slopes.
